title: Jose Mourinho stars in hilarious advert poking fun at moments from his career
text:
Jose Mourinho has poked fun at some of the more controversial moments of his storied career in a hilarious new Paddy Power advert.

The 56-year-old has been out of management since getting sacked by Manchester United in December, giving him time to do some punditry work and take part in campaigns like this one.

The short clip, titled 'Don’t think you’re special', is centred around the Portuguese's ‘Special One’ nickname.

Scroll down for video

Manager Jose Mourinho has poked fun at himself in a new advert for Paddy Power

Mourinho discusses being 'special' with references to some of his controversial moments

It begins with a relaxed Mourinho sitting in his office reading a newspaper which asks: 'What next for the Special One?'

'It's not easy being special,' he says, walking past his trophy cabinet. 'To be special you need to be consistent, I've been special in Milan and Madrid.

'But not all great achievements get trophies,' he continues, looking up to a newspaper snippet cutting with the headline 'United clinch second'.

That, of course, is in reference to Mourinho's controversial claim that finishing runner-ups with United in 2018 may have been his greatest success.

A newspaper snippet about Manchester United finishing second is in his trophy cabinet

Mourinho adopts a wry smile as he is confronted by a cleaner with a laundry basket

We also get close up of a bookcase featuring novels ‘Le Specialiste En Failure’ and ‘The Voyeur’, a nod to the former Chelsea manager's famous war of words with Arsene Wenger.

As Mourinho continues to make his way through his house, which is covered which pictures of himself, he is met by a cleaner who offers him a laundry basket as we hear him say 'to be special you must respect the rules'.

The then Blues boss famously skirted a touchline suspension on the eve of the 2005 Champions League quarter-final against Bayern Munich by getting the Chelsea kit man to help him stow away in the basket.

Mourinho's 'bookcase' contains some amusing references to his rivalry with Arsene Wenger

The Portuguese is also be seen trimming a hedge in the shape of one of his infamous gestures

The advert also shows Mourinho saying 'be humble' while trimming a hedge in the shape of three fingers.

It is another parody of a comment he made as United boss, when he bragged about his three Premier League titles after a defeat by Tottenham last season.

The idea behind the commercial is that you no longer have to be special to win because the jackpot is won daily.
description: Jose Mourinho has poked fun at some of the more controversial moments of his storied career in a new Paddy Power advert centred around his 'Special One' nickname.
